page.title: 02Yetholm Population
page.content: All ages appreciate village life, the quietness, the friendliness, the close intimacy and involvement in community activities, the adsence of vandalism, the beautiful scenery and the pollution free air. Many regret the run down of services, the high cost of private transport and the infrequency and cost of public transport. With long established trades local tradesmen, like Adams the joiner, R&W Young the livestock transporters, Butler the Slaterer, and public and private services providing employment for one sixth of an adult population of nearly 500. Part time employment, mainly for women provides additional family income and is part of our way of life. Over 50 people commute daily to Kelso and a further 40 travel further afield. 20% of the population are retired. 9 adults are unemployed.
